statements.name: PROC BOXPLOT
statements.description: The BOXPLOT procedure creates side-by-side box-and-whiskers plots of measurements organized in groups. A box-and-whiskers plot displays the mean, quartiles, and minimum and maximum observations for a group.

arguments.name: ANNOTATE=
arguments.description: Specifies an ANNOTATE= type data set.

arguments.name: BOX=
arguments.description: Names an input data set containing group summary statistics and outlier values.

arguments.name: DATA=
arguments.description: Names an input data set containing raw data to be analyzed. You cannot use a DATA= data set together with a BOX= or HISTORY= data set.

arguments.name: GOUT=
arguments.description: Specifies the SAS catalog in which to save high-resolution graphics output that is produced by the BOXPLOT procedure.

arguments.name: HISTORY=
arguments.description: Names an input data set containing group summary statistics.

statements.name: BY
statements.description: Obtains separate analyses on observations in groups defined by the BY variables.

arguments.name: DESCENDING
arguments.description: Specifies that the observations are sorted in descending order by the variable that immediately follows the word DESCENDING in the BY statement.

arguments.name: NOTSORTED
arguments.description: Specifies that observations are not necessarily sorted in alphabetic or numeric order.

statements.name: ID
statements.description: The ID statement specifies variables used to identify observations. The ID variables must be variables in the input data set.

statements.name: INSET
statements.description: Each PLOT statement in the BOXPLOT procedure is followed by a series of zero or more INSET and INSETGROUP statements. Each INSET statement in that series produces one inset in the box plot produced by the preceding PLOT statement. If the box plot occupies multiple panels, the inset appears on each panel.

arguments.name: MAX=
arguments.description: Maximum observed value

arguments.name: MEAN=
arguments.description: Mean of all observations

arguments.name: MIN=
arguments.description: Minimum observed value

arguments.name: NMAX=
arguments.description: Maximum group size

arguments.name: NMIN=
arguments.description: Minimum group size

arguments.name: NOBS=
arguments.description: Number of observations in box plot

arguments.name: STDDEV=
arguments.description: Pooled standard deviation

arguments.name: CFILL=
arguments.description: Specifies the color of the background (including the header background if you do not specify the CFILLH= option). CFILL=BLANK leaves the background uncolored and prevents items from showing through the inset.

arguments.name: color
arguments.description: Specifies the color of the background (including the header background if you do not specify the CFILLH= option).

arguments.name: BLANK
arguments.description: Leaves the background uncolored and prevents items from showing through the inset.

arguments.name: CFILLH=
arguments.description: Specifies the color of the header background. By default, if you do not specify a CFILLH= color, the CFILL= color is used.

arguments.name: CFRAME=
arguments.description: Specifies the color of the frame around the inset. By default, the frame is the same color as the axis of the plot.

arguments.name: CHEADER=
arguments.description: Specifies the color of the header text. By default, if you do not specify a CHEADER= color, the INSET statement CTEXT= color is used.

arguments.name: CSHADOW=
arguments.description: Specifies the color of the drop shadow. If you do not specify the CSHADOW= option, a drop shadow is not displayed.

arguments.name: CTEXT=
arguments.description: Specifies the color of the text in the inset. By default, the inset text color is the same as the other text in the box plot.

arguments.name: DATA
arguments.description: Specifies that data coordinates be used in positioning the inset with the POSITION= option.

arguments.name: FONT=
arguments.description: Specifies the font of the text.

arguments.name: FORMAT=
arguments.description: Specifies a format for all the values displayed in an inset.

arguments.name: HEADER=
arguments.description: Specifies the header text. The string can be up to 40 characters.

arguments.name: HEIGHT=
arguments.description: Specifies the height of the inset and header text.

arguments.name: NOFRAME
arguments.description: Suppresses the frame drawn around the inset.

arguments.name: POSITION=
arguments.description: Determines the position of the inset. The position can be a compass point keyword, a margin keyword, or a pair of coordinates. You can specify coordinates in axis percent units or axis data units.

arguments.name: REFPOINT=
arguments.description: Specifies the reference point for an inset that is positioned by a pair of coordinates with the POSITION= option. Use the REFPOINT= option with POSITION= coordinates.

arguments.name: BR
arguments.description: Bottom right

arguments.name: BL
arguments.description: Bottom left

arguments.name: TR
arguments.description: Top right

statements.name: INSETGROUP
statements.description: Each PLOT statement in the BOXPLOT procedure is followed by a series of zero or more INSET and INSETGROUP statements. Each INSETGROUP statement in that series displays statistics associated with individual groups in the box plot produced by the preceding PLOT statement. No more than two INSETGROUP statements can be associated with a given PLOT statement: one that displays group statistics above the box plot and one that displays group statistics below it.

arguments.name: MAX=
arguments.description: Group maximum value

arguments.name: MEAN=
arguments.description: Group mean

arguments.name: MIN=
arguments.description: Group minimum value

arguments.name: N=
arguments.description: Number of observations in group

arguments.name: NHIGH=
arguments.description: Number of outliers above upper fence

arguments.name: NLOW=
arguments.description: Number of outliers below lower fence

arguments.name: NOUT=
arguments.description: Total number of outliers in group

arguments.name: Q1=
arguments.description: First quartile of group values

arguments.name: Q2=
arguments.description: Second quartile of group values

arguments.name: Q3=
arguments.description: Third quartile of group values

arguments.name: RANGE=
arguments.description: Range of group values

arguments.name: STDDEV=
arguments.description: Pooled standard deviation

arguments.name: CFILL=
arguments.description: Specifies the color of the background (including the header background if you do not specify the CFILLH= option). CFILL=BLANK leaves the background uncolored and prevents items from showing through the inset.

arguments.name: color
arguments.description: Specifies the color of the background (including the header background if you do not specify the CFILLH= option).

arguments.name: BLANK
arguments.description: Leaves the background uncolored and prevents items from showing through the inset.

arguments.name: CFILLH=
arguments.description: Specifies the color of the header background. By default, if you do not specify a CFILLH= color, the CFILL= color is used.

arguments.name: CFRAME=
arguments.description: Specifies the color of the frame around the inset. By default, the frame is the same color as the axis of the plot.

arguments.name: CHEADER=
arguments.description: Specifies the color of the header text. By default, if you do not specify a CHEADER= color, the INSET statement CTEXT= color is used.

arguments.name: CTEXT=
arguments.description: Specifies the color of the text in the inset. By default, the inset text color is the same as the other text in the box plot.

arguments.name: FONT=
arguments.description: Specifies the font of the inset text.

arguments.name: FORMAT=
arguments.description: Specifies a format for all the values displayed in an inset.

arguments.name: HEADER=
arguments.description: Specifies the header text.

arguments.name: HEIGHT=
arguments.description: Specifies the height of the inset and header text.

arguments.name: NOFRAME
arguments.description: Suppresses the frame drawn around the inset.

arguments.name: POSITION=
arguments.description: Determines the position of the inset.

arguments.name: TOP
arguments.description: Top of plot, immediately above axis frame

arguments.name: TOPOFF
arguments.description: Top of plot, offset from axis frame

arguments.name: AXIS
arguments.description: Bottom of plot, immediately above horizontal axis

arguments.name: BOTTOM
arguments.description: Bottom of plot, below horizontal axis label

statements.name: PLOT
statements.description: You can specify multiple PLOT statements after the PROC BOXPLOT statement.

arguments.name: ALLLABEL=
arguments.description: Labels the point plotted for the mean of each box-and-whiskers plot with its VALUE or with the value of a variable in the input data set.

arguments.name: VALUE
arguments.description: Labels the point plotted for the mean of each box-and-whiskers plot with its value.

arguments.name: (variable)
arguments.description: Labels the point plotted for the mean of each box-and-whiskers plot with the value of a variable in the input data set.

arguments.name: ANNOTATE=
arguments.description: Specifies an ANNOTATE= type data set.

arguments.name: BLOCKLABELPOS=
arguments.description: Specifies the position of a block variable label in the block legend.

arguments.name: ABOVE
arguments.description: Places the label immediately above the legend.

arguments.name: LEFT
arguments.description: Places the label to the left of the legend.

arguments.name: BLOCKLABTYPE=
arguments.description: Specifies how lengthy block variable values are treated when there is insufficient space to display them in the block legend.

arguments.name: SCALED
arguments.description: The values are uniformly reduced in height so that they fit.

arguments.name: TRUNCATED
arguments.description: Lengthy values are truncated on the right until they fit.

arguments.name: BLOCKPOS=
arguments.description: Specifies the vertical position of the legend for the values of the block variables.
Top of plot, offset from axis frame
Top of plot, immediately above axis frame
Bottom of plot, immediately above horizontal axis
Bottom of plot, below horizontal axis label

arguments.name: BLOCKREP
arguments.description: Specifies that block variable values for all groups be displayed. By default, only the first block variable value in any block is displayed, and repeated block variable values are not displayed.

arguments.name: BLOCKVAR=
arguments.description: Specifies variables whose values are used to assign colors for filling the background of the legend associated with block variables.

arguments.name: BOXCONNECT=
arguments.description: Specifies that the points in adjacent box-and-whiskers plots representing group means, medians, maximum values, minimum values, first quartiles, or third quartiles be connected with line segments. If the BOXCONNECT option is specified without a keyword identifying the points to be connected, group means are connected.
arguments.help: BOXCONNECT=MEAN | MEDIAN | MAX | MIN | Q1 | Q3

arguments.name: MEAN
arguments.description: Specifies that the points in adjacent box-and-whiskers plots representing group means be connected with line segments.

arguments.name: MEDIAN
arguments.description: Specifies that the points in adjacent box-and-whiskers plots representing group medians be connected with line segments.

arguments.name: MAX
arguments.description: Specifies that the points in adjacent box-and-whiskers plots representing group maximum values be connected with line segments.

arguments.name: MIN
arguments.description: Specifies that the points in adjacent box-and-whiskers plots representing group minimum values be connected with line segments.

arguments.name: Q1
arguments.description: Specifies that the points in adjacent box-and-whiskers plots representing group first quartiles be connected with line segments.

arguments.name: Q3
arguments.description: Specifies that the points in adjacent box-and-whiskers plots representing group third quartiles be connected with line segments.

arguments.name: BOXES=
arguments.description: Specifies a variable whose values are used to assign colors for the outlines of box-and-whiskers plots.

arguments.name: BOXFILL=
arguments.description: Specifies a variable whose values are used to assign fill colors for box-and-whiskers plots.

arguments.name: BOXSTYLE=
arguments.description: [Specifies the style of the box-and-whiskers plots displayed.

arguments.name: SKELETAL
arguments.description: The whiskers are drawn from the edges of the box to the extreme values of the group.

arguments.name: SCHEMATIC
arguments.description: A whisker is drawn from the upper edge of the box to the largest observed value within the upper fence, and another is drawn from the lower edge of the box to the smallest observed value within the lower fence.

arguments.name: SCHEMATICID
arguments.description: A schematic box-and-whiskers plot is displayed in which an ID variable value is used to label the symbol marking each observation outside the upper and lower fences.

arguments.name: SCHEMATICIDFAR
arguments.description: A schematic box-and-whiskers plot is displayed in which the value of the ID variable is used to label the symbol marking each observation outside the lower and upper far fences

arguments.name: BOXWIDTH=
arguments.description: Specifies the width (in horizontal percent screen units) of the box-and-whiskers plots.

arguments.name: BOXWIDTHSCALE=
arguments.description: Specifies that the box-and-whiskers plot width is to vary proportionately to a particular function of the group size n.

arguments.name: BWSLEGEND
arguments.description: Displays a legend identifying the function of group size n specified with the BOXWIDTHSCALE= option. No legend is displayed if all group sizes are equal. The BWSLEGEND option is not applicable unless you also specify the BOXWIDTHSCALE= option.

arguments.name: CAXIS=
arguments.description: Specifies the color for the axes and tick marks. This option overrides any COLOR= specifications in an AXIS statement.

arguments.name: CBLOCKLAB=
arguments.description: Specifies fill colors for the frames that enclose the block variable labels in a block legend.

arguments.name: CBLOCKVAR=
arguments.description: Specifies variables whose values are colors for filling the background of the legend associated with block variables.

arguments.name: CBOXES=
arguments.description: Specifies the colors for the outlines of the box-and-whiskers plots created with the PLOT statement.

arguments.name: CBOXFILL=
arguments.description: Specifies the interior fill colors for the box-and-whiskers plots.

arguments.name: CCLIP=
arguments.description: Specifies a color for the plotting symbol that is specified with the CLIPSYMBOL= option to mark clipped values.

arguments.name: CCONNECT=
arguments.description: Specifies the color for line segments connecting points on the plot.

arguments.name: CCOVERLAY=
arguments.description: Specifies the colors for line segments connecting points on overlay plots.

arguments.name: CFRAME=
arguments.description: Specifies the color for filling the rectangle enclosed by the axes and the frame. By default, this area is not filled. The CFRAME= option cannot be used in conjunction with the NOFRAME option.

arguments.name: CGRID=
arguments.description: Specifies the color for the grid requested by the ENDGRID or GRID option. By default, the grid is the same color as the axes.

arguments.name: CHREF=
arguments.description: Specifies the color for the lines requested by the HREF= option.

arguments.name: CLABEL=
arguments.description: Specifies the color for labels produced by the ALLLABEL= option. The default color is the CTEXT= color.

arguments.name: CLIPFACTOR=
arguments.description: Requests clipping of extreme values on the box plot. The factor that you specify determines the extent to which these values are clipped, and it must be greater than 1.

arguments.name: CLIPLEGEND=
arguments.description: Specifies the label for the legend that indicates the number of clipped boxes when the CLIPFACTOR= option is used.

arguments.name: CLIPLEGPOS=
arguments.description: Specifies the position for the legend that indicates the number of clipped boxes when the CLIPFACTOR= option is used.

arguments.name: TOP
arguments.description: Positions the legend at the top of the chart.

arguments.name: BOTTOM
arguments.description: positions the legend at the bottom of the chart.

arguments.name: CLIPSUBCHAR=
arguments.description: Specifies a substitution character (such as '#') for the label provided with the CLIPLEGEND= option.

arguments.name: CLIPSYMBOL=
arguments.description: Specifies a plot symbol used to identify clipped points on the chart and in the legend when the CLIPFACTOR= option is used.

arguments.name: CLIPSYMBOLHT=
arguments.description: Specifies the height for the symbol marker used to identify clipped points on the chart when the CLIPFACTOR= option is used.

arguments.name: CONTINUOUS
arguments.description: Specifies that numeric group variable values be treated as continuous values. By default, the values of a numeric group variable are considered discrete values unless the HAXIS= option is specified. Note: The CONTINUOUS option is not supported for ODS Graphics output.

arguments.name: COVERLAY=
arguments.description: Specifies the colors used to plot overlay variables. Colors in the COVERLAY= list are matched with variables in the corresponding positions in the OVERLAY= list.

arguments.name: COVERLAYCLIP=
arguments.description: Specifies the color used to plot clipped values on overlay plots when the CLIPFACTOR= option is used.

arguments.name: CTEXT=
arguments.description: Specifies the color for tick mark values and axis labels. The default color is the color specified in the CTEXT= option in the most recent GOPTIONS statement.

arguments.name: CVREF=
arguments.description: Specifies the color for the lines requested by the VREF= option.

arguments.name: DESCRIPTION=
arguments.description: Specifies a description of a box plot produced with high-resolution graphics.

arguments.name: ENDGRID
arguments.description: Adds a grid to the rightmost portion of the plot, beginning with the first labeled major tick mark position that follows the last box-and-whiskers plot. You can use the HAXIS= option to force space to be added to the horizontal axis.

arguments.name: FONT=
arguments.description: Specifies a font for labels and legends. You can also specify fonts for axis labels in an AXIS statement. The FONT= font takes precedence over the FTEXT= font specified in the GOPTIONS statement.

arguments.name: FRONTREF
arguments.description: Draws reference lines specified with the HREF= and VREF= options in front of box-and-whiskers plots. By default, reference lines are drawn behind the box-and-whiskers plots and can be obscured by filled boxes.

arguments.name: GRID
arguments.description: Adds a grid to the box plot. Grid lines are horizontal lines positioned at labeled major tick marks, and they cover the length and height of the plotting area.

arguments.name: HAXIS=
arguments.description: Specifies tick mark values for the horizontal (group) axis. If the group variable is numeric, the values must be numeric and equally spaced. If the group variable is character, values must be quoted strings of up to 16 characters. Optionally, you can specify an axis name defined in a previous AXIS statement.

arguments.name: HEIGHT=
arguments.description: Specifies the height (in vertical screen percent units) of the text for axis labels and legends. This value takes precedence over the HTEXT= value specified in the GOPTIONS statement.

arguments.name: HMINOR=
arguments.description: Specifies the number of minor tick marks between major tick marks on the horizontal axis. Minor tick marks are not labeled. The default is HMINOR=0.

arguments.name: HOFFSET=
arguments.description: Specifies the length (in percent screen units) of the offset at both ends of the horizontal axis. You can eliminate the offset by specifying HOFFSET=0.

arguments.name: HORIZONTAL
arguments.description: Experimental] Produces a horizontal box plot, with group variable values on the vertical axis and analysis variable values on the horizontal axis. The HORIZONTAL option is supported only with ODS Graphics.

arguments.name: HREF=
arguments.description: Draws reference lines perpendicular to the horizontal (group) axis on the box plot.

arguments.name: HREFLABELS=
arguments.description: Specifies labels for the reference lines requested by the HREF= option. The number of labels must equal the number of lines. Enclose each label in quotes. Labels can be up to 16 characters.

arguments.name: HREFLABPOS=
arguments.description: Specifies the vertical position of the HREFLABEL= label.
Along top of plot area
Staggered from top to bottom of plot area
Along bottom of plot area
Staggered from bottom to top of plot area

arguments.name: HTML=
arguments.description: Specifies uniform resource locators (URLs) as values of the specified character variable (or formatted values of a numeric variable). These URLs are associated with box-and-whiskers plots when graphics output is directed into HTML. The value of the HTML= variable should be the same for each observation with a given value of the group variable.

arguments.name: IDCOLOR=
arguments.description: Specifies the color of the symbol marker used to identify outliers in schematic box-and-whiskers plots (that is, when you specify the keyword SCHEMATIC, SCHEMATICID, or SCHEMATICIDFAR with the BOXSTYLE= option).

arguments.name: IDCTEXT=
arguments.description: Specifies the color for the text used to label outliers when you specify the keyword SCHEMATICID or SCHEMATICIDFAR with the BOXSTYLE= option.

arguments.name: IDFONT=
arguments.description: Specifies the font for the text used to label outliers when you specify the keyword SCHEMATICID or SCHEMATICIDFAR with the BOXSTYLE= option.

arguments.name: IDHEIGHT=
arguments.description: Specifies the height for the text used to label outliers when you specify the keyword SCHEMATICID or SCHEMATICIDFAR with the BOXSTYLE= option.

arguments.name: IDSYMBOL=
arguments.description: Specifies the symbol marker used to identify outliers in schematic box plots. The default symbol is SQUARE.

arguments.name: INTERVAL=
arguments.description: Specifies the natural time interval between consecutive group positions when a time, date, or datetime format is associated with a numeric group variable.
arguments.help: INTERVAL=DAY | DTDAY | HOUR | MINUTE | MONTH | QTR | SECOND

arguments.name: DAY
arguments.description: For DATE, WEEKDATE, WORDDATE, YYMMDD, or MMDDYY format

arguments.name: DTDAY
arguments.description: For DATETIME format

arguments.name: HOUR
arguments.description: For HHMM or HOUR format

arguments.name: MINUTE
arguments.description: For MMSS format

arguments.name: MONTH
arguments.description: For MONYY format

arguments.name: QTR
arguments.description: For YYQ format

arguments.name: SECOND
arguments.description: For TIME or TOD format

arguments.name: INTSTART=
arguments.description: Specifies the starting value for a numeric horizontal axis when a date, time, or datetime format is associated with the group variable.

arguments.name: LABELANGLE=
arguments.description: Specifies the angle at which labels requested with the ALLLABEL= option are drawn. A positive angle rotates the labels counterclockwise; a negative angle rotates them clockwise. By default, labels are oriented horizontally.

arguments.name: LBOXES=
arguments.description: Specifies the line types for the outlines of the box-and-whiskers plots.

arguments.name: LENDGRID=
arguments.description: Specifies the line type for the grid requested with the ENDGRID option. The default value is 1, which produces a solid line.

arguments.name: LGRID=
arguments.description: Specifies the line type for the grid requested with the GRID option. The default value is 1, which produces a solid line.

arguments.name: LHREF=
arguments.description: Specifies the line type for reference lines requested with the HREF= option. The default value is 2, which produces a dashed line.

arguments.name: LOVERLAY=
arguments.description: Specifies line types for the line segments connecting points on overlay plots. Line types in the LOVERLAY= list are matched with variables in the corresponding positions in the OVERLAY= list.

arguments.name: LVREF=
arguments.description: Specifies the line type for reference lines requested by the VREF= option. The default value is 2, which produces a dashed line.

arguments.name: MAXPANELS=
arguments.description: Specifies the maximum number of panels used to display a box plot. By default, n=20.

arguments.name: MISSBREAK
arguments.description: Determines how groups are formed when observations are read from a DATA= data set and a character group variable is provided.

arguments.name: NAME=
arguments.description: Specifies a name for the box plot, not more than eight characters, that appears in the PROC GREPLAY master menu.

arguments.name: NLEGEND
arguments.description: Requests a legend displaying group sizes. If the size is the same for each group, that number is displayed. Otherwise, the minimum and maximum group sizes are displayed.

arguments.name: NOBYREF
arguments.description: Specifies that the reference line information in an HREF= or VREF= data set be applied uniformly to box plots created for all the BY groups in the input data set. If you specify the NOBYREF option, you do not need to provide BY variables in the reference line data set. By default, you must provide BY variables.

arguments.name: NOCHART
arguments.description: Suppresses the creation of the box plot. You typically specify the NOCHART option when you are using the procedure to compute group summary statistics and save them in an output data set.

arguments.name: NOFRAME
arguments.description: Suppresses the default frame drawn around the plot.

arguments.name: NOHLABEL
arguments.description: Suppresses the label for the horizontal (group) axis. Use the NOHLABEL option when the meaning of the axis is evident from the tick mark labels, such as when a date format is associated with the group variable.

arguments.name: NOOVERLAYLEGEND
arguments.description: Suppresses the legend for overlay plots that is displayed by default when the OVERLAY= option is specified.

arguments.name: NOSERIFS
arguments.description: Eliminates serifs from the whiskers of box-and-whiskers plots.

arguments.name: NOTCHES
arguments.description: Specifies that box-and-whiskers plots be notched.

arguments.name: NOTICKREP
arguments.description: Applies to character-valued group variables and specifies that only the first occurrence of repeated, adjacent group values be labeled on the horizontal axis.

arguments.name: NOVANGLE
arguments.description: Requests that the vertical axis label be strung out vertically.

arguments.name: NPANELPOS=
arguments.description: Specifies the number of group positions per panel.

arguments.name: OUTBOX=
arguments.description: Creates an output data set that contains group summary statistics and outlier values for a box plot.

arguments.name: OUTHIGHHTML=
arguments.description: Specifies a variable whose values are URLs to be associated with outlier points above the upper fence on a schematic box plot when graphics output is directed into HTML.

arguments.name: OUTHISTORY=
arguments.description: Creates an output data set that contains the group summary statistics.

arguments.name: OUTLOWHTML=
arguments.description: Specifies a variable whose values are URLs to be associated with outlier points below the lower fence on a schematic box plot when graphics output is directed into HTML.

arguments.name: OVERLAY=
arguments.description: Specifies variables to be plotted as overlays on the box plot. One value for each overlay variable is plotted at each group position.

arguments.name: OVERLAYCLIPSYM=
arguments.description: Specifies the symbol used to plot clipped values on overlay plots when the CLIPFACTOR= option is used.

arguments.name: OVERLAYCLIPSYMHT=
arguments.description: Specifies the height for the symbol used to plot clipped values on overlay plots when the CLIPFACTOR= option is used.

arguments.name: OVERLAYHTML=
arguments.description: Specifies variables whose values are URLs to be associated with points on overlay plots when graphics output is directed into HTML.

arguments.name: OVERLAYID=
arguments.description: Specifies variables whose formatted values are used to label points on overlays.

arguments.name: OVERLAYLEGLAB=
arguments.description: Specifies the label displayed to the left of the overlay legend produced by the OVERLAY= option. The label can be up to 16 characters and must be enclosed in quotes. The default label is "Overlays:".

arguments.name: OVERLAYSYM=
arguments.description: Specifies symbols used to plot overlay variables. Symbols in the OVERLAYSYM= list are matched with variables in the corresponding positions in the OVERLAY= list.

arguments.name: OVERLAYSYMHT=
arguments.description: Specifies the heights of symbols used to plot overlay variables. Symbol heights in the OVERLAYSYMHT= list are matched with variables in the corresponding positions in the OVERLAY= list.

arguments.name: PAGENUM=
arguments.description: Specifies the form of the label used for pagination. The string can be up to 16 characters, and it must include one or two occurrences of the substitution character '#'. The first '#' is replaced with the page number, and the optional second '#' is replaced with the total number of pages.

arguments.name: PAGENUMPOS=
arguments.description: Specifies where to position the page number requested with the PAGENUM= option.
arguments.help: PAGENUMPOS=TL | TR | BL | BR | TL100 | TR100 | BL0 | BR0

arguments.name: TL
arguments.description: Top left

arguments.name: TR
arguments.description: Top right

arguments.name: BL
arguments.description: Bottom left

arguments.name: BR
arguments.description: Bottom right

arguments.name: TL100
arguments.description: Top left. TL100 ensures that the page number appears at the very top of a page when a title is displayed.

arguments.name: TR100
arguments.description: Top right. TR100 ensures that the page number appears at the very top of a page when a title is displayed.

arguments.name: BL0
arguments.description: Bottom left. BL0 ensures that the page number appears at the very bottom of a page when footnotes are displayed.

arguments.name: BR0
arguments.description: Bottom right. BR0 ensures that the page number appears at the very bottom of a page when footnotes are displayed.

arguments.name: PCTLDEF=
arguments.description: Specifies one of five definitions used to calculate percentiles in the construction of box-and-whiskers plots.
Definition 1 for computing quantile statistics
Definition 2 for computing quantile statistics
Definition 3 for computing quantile statistics
Definition 4 for computing quantile statistics
Definition 5 for computing quantile statistics

arguments.name: REPEAT
arguments.description: Specifies that the horizontal axis of a plot that spans multiple panels be arranged so that the last group position on a panel is repeated as the first group position on the next panel.

arguments.name: SKIPHLABELS=
arguments.description: Specifies the number n of consecutive tick mark labels, beginning with the second tick mark label, that are thinned (not displayed) on the horizontal (group) axis.

arguments.name: SYMBOLLEGEND=
arguments.description: Controls the legend for the levels of a symbol variable.

arguments.name: LEGENDn
arguments.description: You can specify SYMBOLLEGEND=LEGENDn, where n is the number of a LEGEND statement defined previously.

arguments.name: NONE
arguments.description: Suppresses the default legend.

arguments.name: SYMBOLORDER=
arguments.description: Specifies the order in which symbols are assigned for levels of the symbol variable.

arguments.name: DATA
arguments.description: Assigns symbols to values in the order in which values appear in the input data set.

arguments.name: INTERNAL
arguments.description: Assigns symbols based on sorted order of internal values of the symbol variable

arguments.name: FORMATTED
arguments.description: Assigns them based on sorted formatted values.

arguments.name: TOTPANELS=
arguments.description: Specifies the total number of panels to be used to display the plot. This option overrides the NPANEL= option.

arguments.name: TURNHLABELS
arguments.description: Turns the major tick mark labels for the horizontal (group) axis so that they are arranged vertically. By default, labels are arranged horizontally.

arguments.name: VAXIS=
arguments.description: Specifies major tick mark values for the vertical axis of a box plot. The values must be listed in increasing order, must be evenly spaced, and must span the range of values displayed in the plot.

arguments.name: VFORMAT=
arguments.description: Specifies a format to be used for displaying tick mark labels on the vertical axis of the box plot.

arguments.name: VMINOR=
arguments.description: Specifies the number of minor tick marks between major tick marks on the vertical axis. Minor tick marks are not labeled. By default, VMINOR=0.

arguments.name: VOFFSET=
arguments.description: Specifies the length in percent screen units of the offset at the ends of the vertical axis.

arguments.name: VREF=
arguments.description: Draws reference lines perpendicular to the vertical axis.

arguments.name: VREFLABELS=
arguments.description: Specifies labels for the reference lines requested by the VREF= option. The number of labels must equal the number of lines. Enclose each label in quotes. Labels can be up to 16 characters.

arguments.name: VREFLABPOS=
arguments.description: Specifies the horizontal position of the VREFLABEL= label.
Left-justified in plot area
Right-justified in plot area
Left-justified in right margin

arguments.name: VZERO
arguments.description: Forces the origin to be included in the vertical axis for a box plot.

arguments.name: WAXIS=
arguments.description: Specifies the width in pixels for the axis and frame lines. By default, n=1.

arguments.name: WGRID=
arguments.description: Specifies the width in pixels for grid lines requested with the ENDGRID and GRID options. By default, n=1.

arguments.name: WOVERLAY=
arguments.description: Specifies the widths in pixels for the line segments connecting points on overlay plots.
